CloneDB.document: This API is used to clone and rename databases of an instance. The clones are still in the instance from which they are cloned.
CloneDB.name: Clones databases

CreateAccount.document: This API is used to create an instance account.
CreateAccount.name: Creates instance account

CreateBackup.document: This API is used to create a backup.
CreateBackup.name: Creates backup

CreateBackupMigration.document: This API is used to create a backup import task.
CreateBackupMigration.name: Creates backup import tasks

CreateDB.document: This API is used to create a database.
CreateDB.name: Creates database

CreateDBInstances.document: This API is used to create an instance.
CreateDBInstances.name: Creates instance

CreateIncrementalMigration.document: This API is used to create an incremental backup import task.
CreateIncrementalMigration.name: Creates incremental backup import tasks

CreateMigration.document: This API is used to create a migration task.
CreateMigration.name: Creates migration task

DeleteAccount.document: This API is used to delete an instance account.
DeleteAccount.name: Deletes instance account

DeleteBackupMigration.document: This API is used to delete a backup import task.
DeleteBackupMigration.name: Deletes backup import tasks

DeleteDB.document: This API is used to drop a database.
DeleteDB.name: Drops database

DeleteIncrementalMigration.document: This API is used to delete an incremental backup import task.
DeleteIncrementalMigration.name: Deletes incremental backup import tasks

DeleteMigration.document: This API is used to delete a migration task.
DeleteMigration.name: Deletes migration task

DescribeAccounts.document: This API is used to pull the list of instance accounts.
DescribeAccounts.name: Pulls list of instance accounts

DescribeBackupCommand.document: This API is used to query the commands of creating backups canonically.
DescribeBackupCommand.name: Queries the commands of creating backups

DescribeBackupMigration.document: This API is used to create an incremental backup import task.
DescribeBackupMigration.name: Queries backup import tasks

DescribeBackupUploadSize.document: This API is used to query the size of uploaded backup files. It is valid if the backup file type is `COS_UPLOAD` (the file is stored in COS).
DescribeBackupUploadSize.name: Queries the size of uploaded backup files

DescribeBackups.document: This API is used to query the list of backups.
DescribeBackups.name: Queries list of backups

DescribeDBCharsets.document: This API is used to query the database character sets supported by an instance.
DescribeDBCharsets.name: Queries the supported database character sets

DescribeDBInstances.document: This API is used to query the list of instances.
DescribeDBInstances.name: Queries the list of instances

DescribeDBs.document: This API is used to query the list of databases
DescribeDBs.name: Queries the list of databases

DescribeFlowStatus.document: This API is used to query flow status.
DescribeFlowStatus.name: Queries flow status

DescribeIncrementalMigration.document: This API is used to query an incremental backup import task.
DescribeIncrementalMigration.name: Queries incremental backup import tasks

DescribeMigrationDetail.document: This API is used to query migration task details.
DescribeMigrationDetail.name: Queries migration task details

DescribeMigrations.document: This API is used to query the list of eligible migration tasks based on the entered criteria.
DescribeMigrations.name: Queries the list of migration tasks

DescribeOrders.document: This API is used to query order information.
DescribeOrders.name: Queries order information

DescribeProductConfig.document: This API is used to query purchasable specification configuration.
DescribeProductConfig.name: Queries purchasable specification configuration

DescribeRegions.document: This API is used to query purchasable regions.
DescribeRegions.name: Queries purchasable regions

DescribeRollbackTime.document: This API is used to query the time range available for instance rollback.
DescribeRollbackTime.name: Queries time range available for instance rollback

DescribeSlowlogs.document: This API is used to get file information of slow query logs.
DescribeSlowlogs.name: Gets file information of slow query logs

DescribeUploadBackupInfo.document: This API is used to query a backup upload permission.
DescribeUploadBackupInfo.name: Queries backup upload permissions.

DescribeZones.document: This API is used to query currently purchasable AZs.
DescribeZones.name: Queries purchasable AZs

InquiryPriceCreateDBInstances.document: This API is used to query the price of requested instances.
InquiryPriceCreateDBInstances.name: Queries the price of requested instances

InquiryPriceUpgradeDBInstance.document: This API is used to query the upgrade price of an instance.
InquiryPriceUpgradeDBInstance.name: Queries upgrade price of instance

ModifyAccountPrivilege.document: This API is used to modify instance account permissions.
ModifyAccountPrivilege.name: Modifies instance account permissions

ModifyAccountRemark.document: This API is used to modify account remarks.
ModifyAccountRemark.name: Modifies account remarks

ModifyBackupMigration.document: This API is used to modify a backup import task.
ModifyBackupMigration.name: Modifies backup import tasks

ModifyBackupStrategy.document: This API is used to modify the backup policy.
ModifyBackupStrategy.name: Modifies backup policy

ModifyDBInstanceName.document: This API is used to rename an instance.
ModifyDBInstanceName.name: Renames instance

ModifyDBInstanceNetwork.document: This API is used to switch a running instance from a VPC to another.
ModifyDBInstanceNetwork.name: Changes instance network

ModifyDBInstanceProject.document: This API is used to modify the project to which a database instance belongs.
ModifyDBInstanceProject.name: Modifies project to which database instance belongs

ModifyDBName.document: This API is used to rename a database.
ModifyDBName.name: Rename database

ModifyDBRemark.document: This API is used to modify database remarks.
ModifyDBRemark.name: Modifies database remarks

ModifyIncrementalMigration.document: This API is used to modify an incremental backup import task.
ModifyIncrementalMigration.name: Modifies incremental backup import tasks.

ModifyMigration.document: This API is used to modify an existing migration task.
ModifyMigration.name: Modifies migration task

RecycleDBInstance.document: This API is used to return a deactivated SQL Server instance.
RecycleDBInstance.name: Returns a deactivated SQL Server instance

ResetAccountPassword.document: This API is used to reset the account password of an instance.
ResetAccountPassword.name: Resets account password

RestartDBInstance.document: This API is used to restart a database instance.
RestartDBInstance.name: Restarts instance

RestoreInstance.document: This API is used to restore an instance from a backup file.
RestoreInstance.name: Restores instance from backup file

RollbackInstance.document: This API is used to roll back an instance.
RollbackInstance.name: Rolls back instance

RunMigration.document: This API is used to start running a migration task.
RunMigration.name: Runs migration task

StartBackupMigration.document: This API is used to start a backup import task.
StartBackupMigration.name: Starts backup import tasks

StartIncrementalMigration.document: This API is used to start an incremental backup import task.
StartIncrementalMigration.name: Starts incremental backup import tasks

TerminateDBInstance.document: This API is used to isolate an instance to move it into a recycle bin.
TerminateDBInstance.name: Isolates an instance

UpgradeDBInstance.document: This API is used to upgrade an instance.
UpgradeDBInstance.name: Upgrades instance

members.document: Task name
members.name: MigrationName

members.document: If the UploadType is COS_URL, fill in the URL here. If the UploadType is COS_UPLOAD, fill in the name of the backup file here. Only 1 backup file is supported, but a backup file can involve multiple databases.

members.document: Billing mode. Valid value: POSTPAID (pay-as-you-go).
members.name: InstanceChargeType

members.document: Project ID
members.name: ProjectId

members.document: Number of instances purchased this time. Default value: 1. Maximum value: 10
members.name: GoodsNum

members.name: SubnetId

members.document: VPC ID in the format of vpc-dsp338hz. `SubnetId` and `VpcId` should be set or ignored simultaneously
members.name: VpcId

members.document: Length of purchase of instance. The default value is 1, indicating one month. The value cannot exceed 48
members.name: Period

members.document: Whether to automatically use voucher. 0: no, 1: yes. Default value: no
members.name: AutoVoucher

members.document: Array of voucher IDs (currently, only one voucher can be used per order)
members.name: VoucherIds

members.document: SQL Server version. Valid values: 2008R2 (SQL Server 2008 Enterprise), 2012SP3 (SQL Server 2012 Enterprise), 2016SP1 (SQL Server 2016 Enterprise), 201602 (SQL Server 2016 Standard), 2017 (SQL Server 2017 Enterprise). The version purchasable varies by region and can be queried by calling the `DescribeProductConfig` API. If this parameter is left empty, 2008R2 will be used by default.
members.name: DBVersion

members.document: Auto-renewal flag. 0: normal renewal, 1: auto-renewal. Default value: 1.
members.name: AutoRenewFlag

members.document: Security group list, which contains security group IDs in the format of sg-xxx.
members.name: SecurityGroupList

members.document: Configuration of the maintenance window, which specifies the day of the week when maintenance can be performed. Valid values: 1 (Monday), 2 (Tuesday), 3 (Wednesday), 4 (Thursday), 5 (Friday), 6 (Saturday), 7 (Sunday).
members.name: Weekly

members.document: Configuration of the maintenance window, which specifies the start time of daily maintenance.
members.name: StartTime

members.document: Configuration of the maintenance window, which specifies the maintenance duration in hours.
members.name: Span

members.document: The type of purchased high-availability instance. Valid values: DUAL (dual-server high availability), CLUSTER (cluster). Default value: DUAL.
members.name: HAType

members.document: Whether to deploy across availability zones. Default value: false.
members.name: MultiZones

members.document:
Instance status. Valid values:
  • 1: applying
  • 2: running
  • 3: restrictedly running (primary/secondary switching)
  • 4: isolated
  • 5: repossessing
  • 6: repossessed
  • 7: task running (e.g., backing up or rolling back the instance)
  • 8: decommissioned
  • 9: scaling
  • 10: migrating
  • 11: read-only
  • 12: restarting
members.name: Status

members.name: UniqSubnetId

members.document:
Instance isolation.
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: IsolateOperator

members.document:
Pub/sub flag. Valid values: SUB (subscribe instance), PUB (publish instance). If it is left empty, it refers to a regular instance without a pub/sub design.
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: SubFlag

members.document:
Read-only flag. Valid values: RO (read-only instance), MASTER (primary instance with read-only instances). If it is left empty, it refers to an instance which is not read-only and has no RO group.
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: ROFlag

members.document:
Disaster recovery type. Valid values: MIRROR (image), ALWAYSON (AlwaysOn), SINGLE (singleton).
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: HAFlag

members.document:
The list of tags associated with the instance
Note: this field may return `null`, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: ResourceTags

members.document: Filter by backup policy. Valid values: 0 (instance backup), 1 (multi-database backup). If this parameter is left empty, backup policy will not be used in filtering.
members.name: Strategy

members.document: Filter by backup mode. Valid values: 0 (automatic backup on a regular basis), 1 (manual backup performed by the user at any time). If this parameter is left empty, backup mode will not be used in filtering.
members.name: BackupWay

members.document: Filter by backup ID. If this parameter is left empty, backup ID will not be used in filtering.

members.document:
Instance status. Valid values:
  • 1: applying
  • 2: running
  • 3: running restrictedly (primary/secondary switching)
  • 4: isolated
  • 5: repossessing
  • 6: repossessed
  • 7: executing task (e.g., backing up or rolling back instance)
  • 8: deactivated
  • 9: scaling out instance
  • 10: migrating instance
  • 11: read-only
  • 12: restarting
members.name: Status

members.document: Backup file ID, which can be obtained through the `Id` field in the returned value of the `DescribeBackups` API

members.document: ID of the target instance to which the backup is restored. The target instance should be under the same `APPID`. If this parameter is left empty, ID of the source instance will be used.
members.name: TargetInstanceId

members.document: Restore the databases listed in `ReNameRestoreDatabase` and rename them after restoration. If this parameter is left empty, all databases will be restored and renamed in the default format.
members.name: RenameRestore

members.document: Async flow task ID, which can be used to call the `DescribeFlowStatus` API to get the task execution status
members.name: FlowId

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: Instance ID
members.name: InstanceId

members.document: Rollback type. 0: the database rolled back overwrites the original database; 1: the database rolled back is renamed and does not overwrite the original database
members.name: Type

members.document: Database to be rolled back
members.name: DBs

members.document: Target time point for rollback
members.name: Time

members.document: ID of the target instance to which the backup is restored. The target instance should be under the same `APPID`. If this parameter is left empty, ID of the source instance will be used.
members.name: TargetInstanceId

members.document: Rename the databases listed in `ReNameRestoreDatabase`. This parameter takes effect only when `Type = 1` which indicates that backup rollback supports renaming databases. If it is left empty, databases will be renamed in the default format and the `DBs` parameter specifies the databases to be restored.
members.name: RenameRestore

members.document: The async job ID
members.name: FlowId

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: Migration task ID
members.name: MigrateId

members.document: After the migration task starts, the flow ID will be returned
members.name: FlowId

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: Unique ID of slow query log file
members.name: Id

members.document: File generation start time
members.name: StartTime

members.document: File generation end time
members.name: EndTime

members.document: File size in KB
members.name: Size

members.document: Number of logs in file
members.name: Count

members.document: Download address for private network
members.name: InternalAddr

members.document: Download address for public network
members.name: ExternalAddr

members.document:
Status (1: success, 2: failure)
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: Status

SpecInfo.document: Information of purchasable specification for an instance

members.document: Instance specification ID. The `SpecId` returned by `DescribeZones` together with the purchasable specification information returned by `DescribeProductConfig` can be used to find out what specifications can be purchased in a specified AZ
members.name: SpecId

members.document: Model ID
members.name: MachineType

members.document: Model name
members.name: MachineTypeName

members.document: Database version information. Valid values: 2008R2 (SQL Server 2008 Enterprise), 2012SP3 (SQL Server 2012 Enterprise), 2016SP1 (SQL Server 2016 Enterprise), 201602 (SQL Server 2016 Standard), 2017 (SQL Server 2017 Enterprise)
members.name: Version

members.document: Version name corresponding to the `Version` field
members.name: VersionName

members.document: Memory size in GB
members.name: Memory

members.document: Number of CPU cores
members.name: CPU

members.document: Minimum disk size under this specification in GB
members.name: MinStorage

members.document: Maximum disk size under this specification in GB
members.name: MaxStorage

members.document: QPS of this specification
members.name: QPS

members.document: Description of this specification
members.name: SuitInfo

members.document: Pid of this specification
members.name: Pid

members.document:
Pay-as-you-go Pid list corresponding to this specification
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: PostPid

members.document: Billing mode under this specification. POST: pay-as-you-go
members.name: PayModeStatus

members.document: Instance type. Valid values: HA (High-Availability Edition, including dual-server high availability and AlwaysOn cluster), RO (read-only replica), SI (Basic Edition)
members.name: InstanceType

members.document: Whether multi-AZ deployment is supported. Valid values: MultiZones (only multi-AZ deployment is supported), SameZones (only single-AZ deployment is supported), ALL (both deployments are supported)
members.name: MultiZonesStatus

members.document: ID of imported target instance
members.name: InstanceId

members.document: Backup import task ID, which is returned through the API CreateBackupMigration
members.name: BackupMigrationId

members.document: Task ID
members.name: FlowId

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: ID of imported target instance
members.name: InstanceId

members.document: Backup import task ID, which is returned through the API CreateBackupMigration
members.name: BackupMigrationId

members.document: ID of an incremental backup import task
members.name: IncrementalMigrationId

members.document: Task ID
members.name: FlowId

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: List of instance IDs manually terminated in the format of [mssql-3l3fgqn7], which are the same as the instance IDs displayed on the TencentDB Console page
members.name: InstanceIdSet

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: Instance ID in the format of mssql-j8kv137v
members.name: InstanceId

members.document: Memory size after instance upgrade in GB, which cannot be smaller than the current instance memory size
members.name: Memory

members.document: Storage capacity after instance upgrade in GB, which cannot be smaller than the current instance storage capacity
members.name: Storage

members.document: Whether to automatically use vouchers. 0: no, 1: yes. Default value: 0
members.name: AutoVoucher

members.document: Voucher ID (currently, only one voucher can be used per order)
members.name: VoucherIds

members.document: The number of CUP cores after the instance is upgraded.
members.name: Cpu

members.document: Upgrade the SQL Server version. Supported versions include SQL Server 2008 Enterprise (`2008R2`), SQL Server 2012 Enterprise (`2012SP3`), etc. As the purchasable versions are region-specific, you can use the `DescribeProductConfig` API to query the information of purchasable versions in each region. Downgrading is unsupported. If this parameter is left empty, the SQL Server version will not be changed.
members.name: DBVersion

members.document: Upgrade the high availability architecture from image-based disaster recovery to Always On cluster disaster recovery. This parameter is valid only for instances which support Always On high availability and run SQL Server 2017 or later. Neither downgrading to image-based disaster recovery nor upgrading from cluster disaster recovery to Always On disaster recovery is supported. If this parameter is left empty, the high availability architecture will not be changed.
members.name: HAType

members.document: Change the instance deployment scheme. Valid values: `SameZones` (change to single-AZ deployment, which does not support cross-AZ disaster recovery), `MultiZones` (change to multi-AZ deployment, which supports cross-AZ disaster recovery).
members.name: MultiZones

members.document: Order name
members.name: DealName

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: AZ ID in the format of ap-guangzhou-1 (i.e., Guangzhou Zone 1)
members.name: Zone

members.document: AZ name
members.name: ZoneName

members.document: Numeric ID of AZ
members.name: ZoneId

members.document: ID of specification purchasable in this AZ, which, together with the returned value of the `DescribeProductConfig` API, can be used to find out the specifications currently purchasable in the AZ
members.name: SpecId

members.document: Information of database versions purchasable under the current AZ and specification. Valid values: 2008R2 (SQL Server 2008 Enterprise), 2012SP3 (SQL Server 2012 Enterprise), 2016SP1 (SQL Server 2016 Enterprise), 201602 (SQL Server 2016 Standard), 2017 (SQL Server 2017 Enterprise)
members.name: Version
